title: Decoding Market Structure Unveiling the Secrets Part 1 Bonus
description: Deep dive into external structure, internal structure, and multi-timeframe alignment.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• External structure defined by major swings
• Internal structure for entry precision
• Break of Structure (BOS) fundamentals
• Change of Character (CHOCH) signals
• Multi-timeframe alignment importance
• Increasing probability through convergence

quiz.question: External structure is defined by:
quiz.explanation: External structure is formed by the major swing highs and lows on higher timeframes.

quiz.question: Internal structure helps refine:
quiz.explanation: Internal structure on lower timeframes helps fine-tune exact entry points.

quiz.question: Break of Structure (BOS) confirms:
quiz.explanation: BOS is confirmed when price breaks through a previous level, signaling potential continuation.

quiz.question: Change of Character (CHOCH) signals:
quiz.explanation: CHOCH indicates a possible directional change but not a guaranteed reversal.

quiz.question: Multi-timeframe alignment increases:
quiz.explanation: When multiple timeframes confirm the same direction, probability of success increases significantly.
